reviewText: I originally had the VHS version of this, but that was left behind when I relocated to Australia, so I knew what to expect before I bought this. I stumbled across this on amazon, and when I saw the extra matches on this DVD I had to have it. I was a huge Lita fan when she was an active wrestler. She came along when the majority of women in wrestling were purely eye candy. Lita was eye candy too, but with alot of talent for wrestling. She upped the stakes in the womens division of the WWE.The documentary itself is ok, it gets a little boring every now and then, but overall it isn't too long and keeps your attention most of the way through. I love the highlights of the matches included in the documentary. But, as I said, I bought this dvd for the extras. I loved the extra matches that were included. It showed that Lita mixed it up with the men as well as the women. There are about 10 extra matches included, some singles matches, and some mixed tag matches with the Hardy Boys. I only wish the Womens Title match against Chyna was included in full.
Title: N/A

reviewText: With an incredible work rate that compared with the top women in Japan and Mexico, Amy "Lita" Dumas quickly became a fan favorite, though the company was mostly promoting story lines with the female talent that had nothing to do with wrestling.To show her impact was the release of this DVD about 18 months after she "graduated" from the Memphis developmental territory to the big show. The Lita character took off with Team Xtreme - Matt and Jeff Hardy - which was the venue to showcase the fabulous athleticism.The DVD follows the format of biography, going beyond the selling of the character and a wealth of matches. That there wasn't a wealth of Lita story lines to choose from for the latter is caused by Dumas just not being with the company for a long period of time.Though this chronicles a short period of time - and well before the severe injury and personal drama that played out in arenas worldwide - it is an oustanding look at a star in the making.

reviewText: This is by far one of my favorite DVDs.  The video would have been cool, but to get all the extra stuff was nuts.  The way she went from saying "I am going to use all the money I have left, go to Mexico, and learn wrestling."  They takes guts.  And it paid off.  She is amazing.  My favorite part of the whole DVD is the Home Videos.  They are so funny.  I really love the part where they are in her home and talking about the birthday presents.  That is so cool.  I love this DVD.  I can't wait until they come out with one for The Hardy Boyz.

reviewText: Okay, I'll admit it...I'm a wrestling fan.  And I know I'm not alone when I say that one of my favorite wrestlers just happens to be Lita.  Such an amazing blend of beauty, pure talent, and fashion sense...oh, right.  The DVD.  Anyway, this vid is, in its most basic sense, a peek into all that is "Lita" and how it all came to be.  The awesome aerial abilities, the hand gestures, the tattoo, the thong-sticking-out-of-the-jeans-thing; it's just about everything you wanted to know about the lethally lovely diva.  You'll see some childhood photos (a[...] learn how she broke into the business and how she met her pals the Hardy Boyz, and go through the high points of her soaring WWF career.  And yes, you'll see plenty of eye candy in the process (i.e., the Diva Swimsuit shoot--wink wink).  There are also quite a few extras to play with on the DVD; TEN full matches featuring Lita, some more photos (though some of them are a little...weird-lookin'; you'll see for yourself), a closer look at the Swimsuit shoot and the Hardyz' Chef Boyardee commercial, Lita's visit to London, some neat home videos, etc.This DVD is absolutely worth it if you're a Lita fan, and you just may find out some things that you didn't know about her before.  Definitely recommended.

reviewText: Before she suffered setbacks in her professional (neck injury in 2002 that forever changed her inring style) & personal life ("You Screwed Matt!"), the fact is that Lita was the one who started to turn the womens division around with her lucha libre style that you didn't see from women. Lita was the won who put the Womens division back on the map when the division was reduced to champions like Stephanie McMahon, Harvey Wippleman, & The Kat and Lita was the one who carried Trish Stratus in matches back when she was nothing more than a girl hired for just her looks before she became the women's wrestler that everyone remembers her for today.  Unfortunally, all of that got overshadowed in recent years but before all of that happened, she luckly got a DVD which covers her time as the female daredevil that took the WWF by storm that, ironically, showcases her in the way that she should & wanted to be remembered when she left 5 years later.The documentry behinds with various wrestlers & personalities giving their opinions on who Lita is before getting into her childhood of how athletic she was growing up.  The story behind what attracted her to wrestling, her venture into Mexico, working independents (complete with OMEGA footage), and a summerary of her ECW career is talked about.  Her big break with the WWF & how her teaming up with Essa Rios made you take notice of her is discussed along with showing their debut match where Essa won the Lightheavyweight title from Gillberg.  The move from Essa Rios to the Hardy Boyz is up next with the origins of their relationship dating back to the OMEGA promotion, how they innovated the intergender tag match, and the story behind the infamous Matt Hardy/Lita kiss.  Various subjects like the impact of her entrance, her invovlement at WrestleMania X7, and how important it was to her to be involved in an angle where he got assaulted by Triple H & Stone Cold were glossed her.  Highlights of her matches feuds against Stephanie McMahon (RAW), Ivory (Survivor Series where she had her eye busted open), Trish Stratus, and Chyna were shown before going into her close relationships with her mother & pet dog.  They story behind how her feud with Dean Malenko started to showcase her sexuality was discussed before showing highlights of discussing Lita doing various diva/magazine shoots along with the story behind her thong look & her tattoo.  The documentry closes out with Lita talking about her relationship with her fans what what's in the future for her.Along with the documentry, this DVD comes with 10 bonus matches eventhough there are technically 11 of them...Lightheavyweight Champion Gillberg vs. Essa Rios - This match was shown during the documentry & was basically a quick squash with Essa (the former Papi Chulo & Agular from WrestleMania XIV) showing his lucha libre wrestling to win the championship before Lita showcased her own arial ability.w/Hardy Boyz vs. T&A; & Trish Stratus - This was the opening match from Fully Loaded 2000 with had the Hardys in control for the opening minutes while Trish avoided Lita at all cost.  After T&A; regained some leverage with their power offense, it went back & forth before both teams with Trish finally tagging in after T&A; beat down Lita.  However she bounced back & got the victory for Team Xtreme before giving a vicious beating with a leather strap.Strap Match vs. Trish Stratus - This was on the next night from RAW & was real quick as the only noteworthy thing here was the referee getting hit in the eye before Stephanie McMahon interfered to help Trish win.w/Hardy Boyz vs. Edge, Christiain, Jacqueline - Nothing noteworthy here past a fast pased 5 min. match with both Jacqueline & Lita getting their shots on the guys at times.Hardcore Match vs. Jaqueline - As was typical with hardcore matches at that time, this was full of "plunder" as Dusty Rhodes likes to call it.  The match was again less than 5 minutes but look out for the spot where a DDT was executed on a cookiesheet, OUCH!Bra & Panties Match vs. Trish Stratus - It's a bra & panties match that lasted around 3 minutes so you know what to expect here.Elimination Match w/Hardy Boyz vs. Radicalz - This was the opening match from Armageddon 2000 & based around the Dean Malenko/Lita feud going on at that time.  The eliminations happened back to back with Terri Runnels (Saturn's manager) eventually getting involved & recieving a twist of fate that almost knocked her out of her clothes.  It was left between Malenko & Lita in the end where he punished Lita before making her tap out.w/Matt Hardy vs. Saturn & Terri - A short 4 min. match where Dean Malenko interfered to cost Lita & Matt the match.vs. Dean Malenko - This was the conclusion of this feud between the two as Malenko was heavily aggressive & just too much for Lita to overcome before Matt Hardy interfered to help Lita get the victory.  The bigger story here was what happened afterwards between Matt & Lita that even resulted in the perverted Jerry Lawler saying "this is a family show!"vs. Molly Holly - A short match in which Lita was only a background player to the Holly/masked ninja feud (later revealed to be Tori) that was going on at the time.Jeff Hardy vs. Big Show - This match showcased Jeff not being able to get any offense on Big Show so all 3 members of Team Xtreme had to triple team show & even do a pileup win to get the victory.Other DVD extras include various home video clips featuring various people like Hardys & Shannon Moore & Gregory "Hurricane" Helms, a video package of Lita posing at a diva shoot, a feature on her promotional trip of London, another feature on her & the Hardys hosting a spring break bikini contest, a behind the scenes look at their Chef Boyardee commercial including a cameo from TNA star "Fallen Angel" Christopher Daniels, and a picture slideshow.In the end, people can say this DVD would be incomplete for everything that happened after this documentry ended but I still say that this is the near perfect tribute for Lita as this was her in her prime & heavily showcased her journey to the top of the WWF.  The only real negative downfall I can say here is that most of the short irrelevant matches could have been replaced with matches that were more important to her career.  But besides this, if you want to know & remember Lita the way she wanted to be remembered before her career was forever changed because of her injury & personal life made public then pick this up.
summary: Showcasing The Way She SHOULD Be Remembered

reviewText: Lita has lit up the world of WWF Divas in a short time, and deservedly so. She's sexy, she's a daredevil when it comes to wrestling, she plays up to the crowd, and she is always in the middle of autograph sessions.The Lovely Lita (real name Amy Dumas) recaps her flight to superstardom in this well-done 60-minute presentation, showing her starting out in ECW, her debut in WWF to her cover photo on the WWF Divas 2001 magazine. She is also going to be on the cover of the December WWF magazine.Lita reveals the personal side of herself, her home life, her friendship with the Hardys, getting close to her mother once again, and sharing with us the gifts she receives from her legions of fans that grow daily.Also featured are comments from WWF personalities Jim Ross, Essa Rios, Trish Stratus and Stephanie McMahon Helmsley.A complete package of one of the hottest, and I do mean hottest, WWF Divas in the business. She runs a close second to Trish Stratus as far as being my favorite.

reviewText: Lita: It Just Feels Right gives fans an in-depth look at who Lita is inside and outside the ring. Throughout the DVD, you learn all about Lita's personality and see that she's really an enjoyable person in real life and treats everyone with a high amount of respect. The documentary is split up into 2 chapters which covers how she got involved in wrestling and the entire first year of her career in WWF. The documentary is literally the total package for the first year of Lita's career to get everyone caught up. It covers her feuds with people like Trish Stratus, Stephanie McMahon, Jacqueline, Ivory, Dean Malenko, Chyna, The Power Trip, and many many more. This is a must have for any and all Lita fans and you definitely won't be disappointed that you bought it.Extra Matches included are:1.) Fully Loaded 2000: Team Xtreme vs T&A; and Trish Stratus- This was a good solid match that saw pretty much every member from each team get quality time in the ring. Definitely worth a watch2.) Raw: Strap Match: Lita vs Trish Stratus- After being whipped weeks before by Trish, Lita got her revenge. Stephanie McMahon (who Lita had just entered a feud with) gets involved in the match and gives Trish a hand in the outcome of the match3.) Smackdown: Edge and Christian and Jacqueline vs Team Xtreme- Nothing too noteworthy about this match but there was a bit of a funny pre-match promo from E&C;4.) Raw: Women's Championship Hardcore Match: Lita vs Jacqueline- This match proves how divas weren't afraid to get mean and ruthless and ruin their good looks back then. The match didn't last very long but it got pretty ugly though5.) Raw: Women's Championship Bra & Panties Match: Lita vs Trish Stratus- Around or less than 5 minutes. It's a Bra & Panties match. What more needs to be said?6.) Armageddon 2000: 6 Person Intergender Elimination Tag Team Match: Team Xtreme vs Dean Malenko, Eddie Guerrero, and Terri- Pretty good match from the Armageddon PPV that lasted a decent amount of time. The eliminations went back to back until Dean Malenko and Lita were the final two. Dean ended up abusing and toying with Lita before making her tap out to the Cloverleaf7.) Smackdown: Lita and Matt Hardy vs Terri and Perry Saturn- Relatively short match that ends with an interference from Dean Malenko to cost Lita and Matt the match8.) Raw: Lita vs Dean Malenko- This was the final showdown that put the cherry on top of the Malenko/Lita feud. A one on one bout that Malenko almost won but was stopped by Matt Hardy who assisted Lita in the win. What happens after the match is one of the classic Raw moments from the Attitude Era where Lita and Matt share their first kiss on live tv9.) Raw: Lita vs Molly Holly - Not much to be said about this match other than it being a short one and not much else needs to be said10.) Smackdown: Jeff Hardy w/Lita vs Big Show- Not even sure why this match got put on here. Lita doesn't wrestle in this match but just manages JeffOther Extras:Home Vid Clips: This extra is split into the 3 different clips. The first one shows Lita and The Hardys hanging out with real life friends Shannon Moore and Shane Helms on Lita's birthday just having a good time and enjoying life. The second one is a clip of Lita playing with her dog, Cody in her backyard and the last clip is Lita milking a cow on a farmer's ranch, somewhere in North CarolinaNice... Nice...: Just a brief maybe 45 second video of Lita posing in different bikinis. Looks like it was probably taken from one of the Diva DVDsI See London: This clip features Lita touring London to promote WWF's Insurrextion PPV they had in 2001Spring Break: A clip that shows Team Xtreme hanging out around the beach area of Houston to promote Wrestlemania X7Chef, Girl, Hardyz: A behind the scenes video of Team Xtreme's shooting for a Chef Boyardee commercialFreeze Frame: A slideshow of pictures featuring Lita. Prom childhood pictures to live event/televised pictures, fan pictures, art drawings, etcOverall: This is a really good Lita DVD that gives you a lot for someone who had only been in the company for a year. However, I felt that they should've waited a few years to make this DVD just so there were more moments and matches to be featured. 2003, right around the time she returned from her neck injury would've been a good time to make this DVD. Nonetheless it's enjoyable.
summary: Excellent Documentary That Highlights The Fiery Red Haired Lita But Released Too Soon

reviewText: Lita: It Just Feels Right is a documentry based on the flame haired divas time in the WWE. There is also lots of childhood pictures and personal footage of her home. It is a nice program which covers her rise to fame, highlighting her greatest moments, alliances and title wins. If you are a Lita fan this is definately worth buying. The DVD contains a wealth of good extras, ranging from a huge total of 10 extra matches to some video packages. There is also some amusing home video clips. The boxart is quite attractive, with a picture of Lita surrounded with a pink background. There is an insert card inside telling you all the chapters and extras. I will run through both the chapters and extras:Main Feature:Who is Lita? - This chapter has comments on Lita from the Hardy brothers, Trish Stratus, Stephanie McMahon and Jim Ross. It then has some introductory talking from Lita and then the music opening hits.Big Break - A good chapter, focusing on Litas break into the independant scene. Lita then shows a collection of masks she keeps in her home kitchen. There is some fascinating OMEGA footage, and it then disscusses Litas big break into the WWE, along with her alliance with Essa Rios.Lita Teams Up - This chapter is all about Litas alliance with the Hardy Boyz. It has several match clips from Fully Loaded and Smackdown, and also feautures the big kiss angle between Lita and Matt Hardy.Superstar - An intresting chapter which includes Wrestlemania footage of Litas Wrestlemania debut, along with comments from Lita.vs. Stephanie - This covers Litas feud with Stephanie in mid 2000. It shows most of the match, along with commentery from both Stephanie and Lita. Steph disscusses a injury she almost got, and Lita talks about winning the strap/Bumpy Road - This has lots of Survivor Series 2000 footage of Lita battling Ivory. This was when Lita got a nasty cut above her eye, but still finished the match. It has some unique footage of Lita talking to her Mum after the match, and footage of Lita and her dog at home.vs. Trish - A video package of the feud between the two divas, and highlights of the HHH/Trish vs. Rock/Lita Raw tag match. Includes comments from Trish.vs. Chyna - Short chapter which just reviews Litas match with Chyna at Judgment Day.Love and Hate - One minute music video covering her feud with Dean Malenko.Diva-Licious - Lots of Hedonism footage of the divas shoot, with lots of nice swimsuit scenes with Lita. Lita also describes how she came up with the thong sticking out of pants look.Admirers - Lita talks about her fans, and shows all the scrapbooks and merchandise she has recieved off fans. Look out for a very artistic portrait of Lita.Bright Future - Final comments from everyone, with Lita describing what she would like to acheive in the future, along with some good in ring footage of Lita.The main feature lasts around 60 minutes.Extras:Matches:Hardy Boyz and Lita vs. T & A and Trish (Fully Loaded 00)Strap Match - Lita vs. Trish (Raw, July 00)Edge, Christian and Jackie vs. The Hardys and Lita (Smackdown, August 00)Hardcore Match - Lita vs. Jackie (Raw, October 00)Bra and Panties Match - Lita vs. Trish (Raw, October 00)Hardy Boyz and Lita vs. Radicalz (Armageddon 00)Lita and Matt Hardy vs. Terri and Perry Saturn (Smackdown, January 01)Lita vs. Dean Malenko (Raw, February 01)Lita vs. Molly Holly (Raw, February 01)Jeff Hardy vs. The Big Show (Smackdown, April 01)Video Packages:Home Video clips - Clips of Lita at her birthday party, with her dog and trying to milk a cow.Nice...Nice... - Musical swimsuit video of Lita.I see London - Video of Litas promotional tour in London.Spring Break - Footage of the Hardys and Lita judging a swimsuit contest.Chef,Girl,Hardys - Behind the scenes footage of Litas Chef Boyardee commercial.Freeze Frame - About fifteen pics of Lita, set to change every 10 seconds.There is roughly 80 minutes of extras.Obviously, this is a must have for Lita fans. The main feauture is great and very informative on Litas career. The extras aren't too shabby either, with over 80 minutes of extra footage. It gives a nice insight on Lita, and it is well worth adding this to your DVD library.Final Rating - Five Stars (*****) Excellent.
summary: A excellent profile on the eXtreme diva Lita

reviewText: This is one of my favourite wrestling DVDs. There is a feel-good factor all the way through, because the period covered by the DVD is the time when Lita was at her absolute peak. The crowd just loved her, and there are 'Lita! Lita!' chants during many of the matches, even intergender matches, when it is unusual for a woman to get so much attention for her wrestling ability rather than just her looks.Lita is my favourite female wrestler of all time and this DVD completely does her justice. I can't imagine anybody watching this and not being impressed. All her best moves (including the spectacular moonsaults and hurricanranas) are shown many times. You also get to see some early ring-work from Trish Stratus (when her in-ring repertoire was limited to a few kicks and bulldog headlocks) and some great moves from Molly Holly (who I wish had her own DVD, but that's another story...)The documentary itself is just under an hour long. It looks at Lita's history before WWE and then focusses on her debut with Essa Rios. It is amazing to see how over she was with the crowd even in her first appearance with Essa Rios, when she did a moonsault at the end of his match against Gilberg. The crowd completely responded to her ability to do moves that nobody had seen a woman do before, at least not in WWE anyway. Just look at the faces of the people in the crowd when she climbs to the top rope and does the back flip - they are blown away!The documentary also shows highlights of some memorable matches. My favourite is the RAW main event when Lita took on Stephanie McMahon-Helmsley with The Rock as special guest referee. The match is trimmed in the documentary, but still all the best bits are included and none of the excitement of the match is lost. The documentary also includes Lita and Matt Hardy's 'first' kiss, a summary of Lita's feud with Trish Status and some footage of Lita doing photoshoots in New York and on the beach.The real quality of the DVD shines through with the many extras. If only WWE would put extras of this quality on all their releases, I would be very happy! The extras include 10 matches (some are short, but others are longer) and most of them include full ring entrances. The matches are a mixture of singles matches and intergender / tag team matches where Lita teams up with the Hardy Boys. The matches are against team such as T & A with Trish, Edge & Christian and the Radicalz. The rather amusing feud between Lita and Dean Molenko is also shown. There are also other short extras including Lita on a trip to London (fun for me to see as I'm from England), Lita posing for Diva photoshoots, and some home video footage.Overall, I highly recommend this DVD to fan's of Lita and quality wrestling. It's quite hard to get hold of the DVD now (because it is one of the old WWF DVDs, before the name change to WWE, so no new copies are being made) but it's worth making an effort to track it down. I've watched it many times since I first bought it and I look forward to watching it loads more in the future. Thank you Lita!
